text: @mjtsai Absolutely. Should be notet on 36pt Helvetica on their download page. I wasted hours fiuntil i found this out. Better yet, fix it.
@mjtsai The only way to sync down to a different folder would be to move the folder on a remote machine or their web-interface (if possible)
@danielpunkass You'd also need to change a file on the remote side otherwise there wouldn't be a change. DB doesn't do resource forks though
@mjtsai Don't even waste your time trying. Dropbox doesn't support resource forks nor extended attributes. Unfortunately.
@danielpunkass UI is always responsive here, even after a marathon backup of 14 hours. Filetransfer is slow though. On a BlackBook fwiw.
In Strasbourg. SO many good restaurants, so hard to chose.
@rands Oh yes, my Leica is constantly set to 16:9 too. Such a difference.
@rands Wikipedia if that counts as a web app.
@danielpunkass Allthough you didn't ask me, i'll tell you, that my TomTom GO 720T works well for me.
@jasonfried True. Good mood music.
@zeldman I once had a coworker crashing macs by just touching them. Luckily i have the opposite powers and make them work again by touching.
@zeldman You, Sir and technology don't seem to be best friends. SMSes not delivered, iPhone and Sync Problems?  There are many like you.
@danielpunkass Good to know. How clever from them. So we can at least hire someone to compile the code in MS VisualStudio or port it to OSX.
@danielpunkass And hopefully, JungleDisk will still be in business the day we need to restore something ;-)
@danielpunkass Ah, ok. Thanks. So hopefully that backup of ca. 40 GB will ever finish. Next try: A Bucket on an S3 Server in Europe.
@danielpunkass Does JungleDisk also slow to a crawl for you sometimes? I backup with 568 kbit/s currently on a 25Mbit leased line. Not ISDN!
@danielpunkass They did that to make you agree to modified terms.
@chadyj Gotcha. S3 Reports...
@chadyj I need a little more context to understand the :-) you just twittered me
Also, why does Amazon make me download S3 Usage-Reports as CSV files to view in Excel. I have a browser supporting the <table> tag.
@fdejako I had errors about failed file deletions too. Sucks. I'd so love to backup to S3 with JungleDisk, but waiting for deletions - hmmm
Sheesh, what decade are we living in where deleting an entire S3 Bucket takes 45 minutes. Thank god for real filesystem on my personal HD.
@rands Priceless. Brilliant. Ingenious. Thanks for linking!

#!/bin/sh
cn=999
i=1
while ["$i" -le $cn ]
do
/usr/bin/curl -I -s "http://pleasefixtheiphone.com/votes/vote/2154"
i=`expr $i + 1`
done

@adamengst why not use rsync directly via cron. I do that and run it every 8 hours. Saved my bacon once (allthough on 10.3.9 i use psync).
@adamengst For DB backups you should never backup the actual DB. Dump them elsewhere and back that up. Definitively!
@adamengst Curious wether you write something up about your recent experience with your various backup solutions which failed. Interresting!
